title: The burden of disease vs. GDP per capita
subtitle:
The burden of disease is measured in Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs). DALYs measure the total burden of disease â€“ both from years of life lost due to premature death and years lived with a disability.
One DALY equals one lost year of healthy life. Here it is age-standardized and expressed per 100,000 individuals.
sourceDesc: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019); Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
